Watson collection of World War I and World War II illustrations and cartoons 1977.278Collection processed by Nicholas PavlikThis collection was processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.Brooklyn Historical SocietyCenter for Brooklyn History128 Pierrepont StreetBrooklyn 11201cbhreference@bklynlibrary.org

Brooklyn Historical Society
Edward B. Watson collection of World War I and World War II illustrations and cartoons
Watson, Edward B.
1977.278
0.3 Linear Feet in three folders.
1914-1945 1914-1920 This collection consists of color illustrations and black-and-white cartoons relating to air, land, and sea activities during World War I and World War II. The cartoons were collected by Edward B. Watson and were clipped from various New York City newspapers and magazines. A0058
Immediate Source of Acquisition
Gift of Edward B. Watson, 1965.
Conditions Governing Access
Open to users without restriction.
Processing Information
Minimally processed to the collection level.
Preferred Citation
Identification of item, date (if known); Edward B. Watson collection of World War I and World War II illustrations and cartoons, 1977.278, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Public Library, Center for Brooklyn History.
Related Materials
Center for Brooklyn History holds the following related materials:
- World War I political cartoons collection, 1916-1918 (CBHM.0011)
